revised_title: The Mysterious Burning Mountains of the Molucca Islands
tldr: In 1693, the inhabitants of the Isle of Sorea experienced a series of terrifying events as their island was shaken by a mountain that began spewing fire and smoke. The mountain eventually formed a burning lake that consumed much of the island. The author describes the events and compares them to similar occurrences on other islands in the Molucca region. This account provides a glimpse into the understanding of natural disasters and geological phenomena during that time.
